attributes.action: MPs to take a paycut down to 67% of salary in support of furlough workers
attributes.additional_details:
This would help parliament show they are more in touch with people rather than puppets for global elitest families. 
Any self respecting MP should see this as a badge of honour until restrictions are lifted
attributes.background: MPs are some of the highest paid people in the country and despite no scientific proof have closed hospitality businessses putting those working on 67% of wages . While businesses are closed MPs should also take a paycut to 67% of wages until restrictions are lifted.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out how to contact IPSA here:

http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/
